title: Hybrid Instructional Design Program for Interprofessional Collaborative Competency in Healthcare

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Knowledge of Healthcare System Structures and Job-Related Fundamentals
context.additional_context: Blended teaching methodology program for medical administrative/professional staff to enhance interdisciplinary collaboration competencies

learning_goals: Learners achieve at least 15% improvement in collaboration readiness scores on the RIPLS scale assessment upon completing the IPE program
Learners maintain a participation rate of over 80% in ARCS-V motivation design model-based activities and sustain a self-directed learning attitude
Learners apply interprofessional communication protocols with 90% accuracy across three simulated scenarios (clinical/administrative/crisis situations)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
